item.title: A very colorful 4th birthday
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: Today we celebrated Maggie’s 4th birthday with LOTS of rainbows!  Thankfully, despite a forecast all week of rain, it held off and we were able to enjoy an evening of fun, friends, and cake!

item.title: Happy happy birthday, Graeme!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
And in the blink of an eye, Graeme has turned 1.

Our littlest has turned from a wrinkled little baby to a fearless, energetic, joyful toddler. Still in love with his big sister, Graeme tries his hardest to keep up with her, and it won’t be long until he does!  He’s days away from officially being a walker (has done up to 10 steps so far), attacks challenges with full force, and has a stubborn determination.  Some tidbits on Graeme today:

Teeth: 3 up top, 3 on the bottom
Favorite sayings: Ah and Da
Preferred language: Spanish (thank you Nuvia!)
Loves: all things with wheels, any protein-based foods, dancing to music, his best friend Mikey.
Personality: busy, stubborn, loving, and silly

We celebrated his birthday with family and friends, and the love and superpowers were in full force!

item.title: Another holiday season in the books
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: We celebrated Graeme’s 1st and Maggie’s 4th Christmas with no shortage of candy canes, caroling, and cheer! Maggie was really into Christmas this year and it made everything all the more exciting – from writing her list, to shopping for her brother and daddy, to posing for the holiday card photo, she did it all with a smile on her face and a skip in her step.  We got to meet Santa, see the Nutcracker her dance school put on, decorate gingerbread houses, and see lots of family and friends – while it’s always sad when the holidays are over, ours were so jam-packed that I’m looking forward to a quiet January!

item.title: Graeme’s Newborn Shoot
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
We had Lyndsay over in early July to capture some photos of our new expanded family – I absolutely love how they came out!  Maggie is so in love with Graeme and you can really see it in these photos, I love watching her interact with him and her gentle touch makes me love her even more than I thought possible! I know this phase won’t last forever – talk to me when he is big enough to start getting into her stuff – but I’ll relish it while it’s here!

Here are some favorites:

item.title: Graeme has arrived!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
So it all started 10 days earlier…I spent a night barely sleeping as my whole body was itchier than I had ever experienced.  I put a call in to the doctor who recommended going in for some blood work, hmmm. Monday’s blood work followed with an appointment Tuesday with my dr.  At this point, we weren’t sure what was going on, but there was a chance of an issue called obstetric cholestasis and so began the week of stress.  We went back and forth with whether or not there was a need to induce, had more blood work and ultrasounds every other day, all while waiting on ONE test to come back that can take 5-7 days (why any blood test takes that long, I have no idea!).  Finally came the morning of Maggie’s recital and the day we were due to find out for sure, yes or no on an induction.  A morning call from my doctor said, we’re in the clear – we’ll wait for you to go into labor naturally.  So off we went to Maggie’s recital relieved that everything was okay.  At intermission, I check my phone and have a voicemail from my doctor “nothing urgent, but call me when you can” – turns out after a day of discussing my case with some other physicians and diving closely into my blood work, they decided I was, in fact, a candidate for an induction and…could I come in tonight?

We drove Maggie home, put her to bed, packed up the car and headed for the hospital, leaving Maggie with Nana.  At this point, they were happy to induce and see if my body would go into labor itself – after a C-section with Maggie, I was more than happy to try and avoid that scenario again.

We started the induction and settled in for a long night/few days….after about 12 hours, we decided the induction wouldn’t work, Graeme wasn’t responding well to the contractions and they didn’t want to push it, and so a repeat c-section was planned and by 1:31pm on June 13, we welcomed our baby boy!

Introducing Graeme Robert Harrington, weighing 6lbs 11oz and measuring 19 inches, and as scrumptious as they come!

item.title: Waiting on baby brother
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
We’re less than 5 weeks from the due date for Baby Boy Harrington and we’re all getting ready.  Maggie loves to “listen” to my belly and tell me things like “the new baby says he wants to come out” or put her finger in my belly button and giggle that the baby is tickling her – it’s all really sweet and quite a change from her initial reaction!  As excited as she has become, I know she has NO idea what is really coming and how different life will be, but I know in the long run it’ll be worth the initial struggles to have a sibling, a friend for life.

Although I didn’t bother when pregnant with Maggie, we decided to do some maternity photos this time round – mainly because I wanted to capture some last photos before we became a family of 4.  We used Lyndsay Hannah Photography who I can’t say enough about! She is a friend of a friend who, despite only doing this for a short time professionally, is super talented – plus a really sweet person, which always helps!  Maggie had a blast and Elm Bank in Wellesley is going to be a new destination for us – their children’s garden was amazing.  Here are a few favorites!

item.title: Happy Holidays
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
We had a wonderful holiday season – Maggie really started to understand what was going on this year and was so excited.  We embraced every opportunity to celebrate the holidays including a night to Edaville Railroad, a toddler-friendly showing of the Nutcracker by the Metrowest Ballet and of course, lots of visits with friends and family!

The lead up….

  

Christmas!

and New Years!

item.title: 5 years?!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Somehow, 5 years of marriage have passed – between travel, buying a house, and having a child, things have definitely changed from that day back in 2010, yet it still feels like only yesterday!

Happy anniversary to us!

item.title: Summer, Summer, Summertime.
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
This summer was full of activity – here are some highlights!

Ireland (see Erin Go Bragh post)

Maggie’s First Red Sox Game

Pat, Grandma, Auntie Mare, and I took Maggie to her first Red Sox game on June 13 (bonus – don’t need a ticket until they’re 2!) Fenway has really stepped up the kid-friendly atmosphere by adding in the “Clubhouse” area where you can color, build legos, take photos with Wally, and more! And best part was – it’s all air conditioned.  If you’re attempting to entertain a toddler for the length of a baseball game, this is the way to do it!

    

4th of July in NH

   

Cape Cod with the Healeys

 

Birthdays

We celebrated Maggie’s 2nd birthday (See Two.), Aoife’s 1st birthday, and Phelan’s 3rd birthday – there was plenty of fun and cake to go around!

Connecticut with Stuycks

A friend of mine from my time in London, Chrissy, has FINALLY made her way back stateside with her husband and two adorable children.  They are currently living in Miami, but when she was up visiting her family at their beach house in Connecticut for a few weeks, we couldn’t turn down the offer of a weekend getaway!  Maggie and Pia (Sophia, officially, who is just shy of 4) became fast friends and we haven’t stopped hearing about her every since! You’d think these two had known each other their whole lives and were instantly thick as thieves!

Paige’s Wedding

My BC roommate, Paige, was married in Provincetown near the end of summer and it gave Pat and I a blissful weekend away without Maggie (first full weekend since she was born!).  While she was off being entertained by her many grandparents, we enjoyed a weekend of sun, sand, cocktails, and belly laughs with all the BC biddies and buddies.  Can’t wait for the next wedding! (Looking at you, Janelle!!).

         

Jenni’s Wedding

The weekend following Paige’s wedding, Pat’s friend from college Jenni was married in Falmouth – being a more kid-friendly wedding, we brought Maggie with us to the Sea Crest Hotel (which I can NOT recommend more!) to enjoy some pool and beach time, plus experience her first wedding.  Living up to her mother’s (and Nana’s!) reputation of being a permanent fixture on any wedding dance floor, Maggie was the FIRST one up – and had quite a time twirling and dancing with Pat. (to many “awws” from all his friends!).  We are still hearing all about “Jenni the Princess” in her pretty white dress!

 

As the summer comes to a close, I’ve realized we really packed in a lot (and these were just the highlights!).  The only silver lining to summer ending is it brings in my favorite season – fall!

item.title: Two.
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Two. Years. How has it been two years??

What feels equally like a lifetime and a blink of an eye – Maggie turned two this month.  She has become quite the character over in the past year, and definitely in the last few months.  A chatty girl who loves all things purple, has a new obsession with dinosaurs, and has more “buddies” at school than we can name – she is growing into a little girl and is definitely no longer a baby.

A quick look at Maggie today:

Favorite songs: Baa Baa Black Sheep, Let It Go, ABCs
Loves to recite “5 Little Monkeys”
Stands at 34 inches and weighs 26 lbs – right in the middle of curve for her age on both.
Talking in short sentences – including “I do it myself” and “I like this ____ ”
Must have for sleep – Giraffe and Owl lovies (one of each) – thankfully we have 2 of each so they get washed biweekly!
Favorite new activity: letting mommy paint her toenails, purple of course.

We celebrated her birthday with the Harringtons/Healeys over the July 4th weekend, saw all of mommy’s side the day prior to her birthday at Aoife’s 1st birthday party, and had a special visit with the Blaisdell twins on her actual birthday.  3 different events with lots of cake, presents, and all our favorite people made for a great 2nd celebration!
